customer_concentration.disclosure_notes: Form 10-K: 'No single customer accounted for more than 10% of the Company’s consolidated net revenue' for fiscal years ended Jan 31, 2025; Feb 2, 2024; Feb 3, 2023. Top-10 customers percent not disclosed.

segment_mix.notes: Consumer percent is calculated from FY2024 reporting; B2G is an estimate because Dell does not publish a government-only percent; B2B is the residual and includes enterprise, hyperscalers, SMB, education, healthcare, and government where not separately reported.

customer_characteristics.typical_contract_length: Business leases 2–4 years; fixed-term loans 3–5 years; revolving loans ~12 months; As‑a‑Service/subscriptions typically multiyear.
customer_characteristics.recurring_vs_transactional: Mixed; recurring revenue defined as maintenance, subscriptions, as-a-Service and operating leases; Dell is investing to grow recurring revenue via APEX and consumption models; no single percentage disclosed.

industry_exposure.notes: Company maintains dedicated federal/state/local programs; not quantified (best-estimate 8–12% of revenue as noted above).
ongoing target vertical; Dell points to tailored offerings and sales programs for healthcare customers (no % disclosed).
called out as a public institution vertical; no % disclosed.

called out in FY26 Q3 press release and slides describing large AI server orders and multi-billion-dollar orders; trend: increasing importance (AI server orders cited as record $12.3B in Q3 FY26 press release). These customers are an important and growing part of ISG revenue, particularly servers & networking.
mentioned generically as served markets in go-to-market text but not quantified.
